body_html:
A ? in a shape output means "unknown dimenson value", and that is
considered compatible with a dimension with a known size. So I'm not sure
it would give an error from that step.

Does it fail when running the model, or while setting up the model? What
is the error message you get?

On Fri, Jul 15, 2016 at 1:21 AM, isabeaups notifications@github.com wrote:

Thank you for looking into it.
I'm seeing this in the PyCharm debugging mode.

I think you are right, I missidentified the problem. shp is actually ok,
the problem occurs while using
tf.random_normal(shp,mean=0,stddev=1)

This occures inside my _build_graph methode of a neural network.

I have the following line:

xtilde = x + noise_level * tf.random_normal(tf.shape(x),
mean=0.,
stddev=1.)

which fails because
while x.get_shape() = (?,?,1)
tf.random_normal(tf.shape(x),mean=0,stddev=1).get_shape() = (?,?,?)

and so the addition fails because the tensors are not of the same shape.

So the problem is that tensorflow.random_normal has fails to be correctly
shaped when the last dimension is 1.

—

body:
A ? in a shape output means "unknown dimenson value", and that is
considered compatible with a dimension with a known size.  So I'm not sure
it would give an error from that step.

Does it fail when running the model, or while setting up the model?  What
is the error message you get?
